connector.description: Read and write data from to/from a CMIS compliant content repositories.

camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize
camel.sink.endpoint.pageSize.description: Number of nodes to retrieve per page

camel.sink.endpoint.readContent.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readContent
camel.sink.endpoint.readContent.description: If set to true, the content of document node will be retrieved in addition to the properties

camel.sink.endpoint.readCount.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readCount
camel.sink.endpoint.readCount.description: Max number of nodes to read

camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryId
camel.sink.endpoint.repositoryId.description: The Id of the repository to use. If not specified the first available repository is used

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.queryMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queryMode
camel.sink.endpoint.queryMode.description: If true, will execute the cmis query from the message body and return result, otherwise will create a node in the cmis repository

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionFacadeFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionFacadeFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionFacadeFactory.description: To use a custom CMISSessionFacadeFactory to create the CMISSessionFacade instances

camel.component.cmis.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.cmis.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.cmis.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.cmis.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.cmis.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.cmis.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.cmis.sessionFacadeFactor.name: camel.component.cmis.sessionFacadeFactory
camel.component.cmis.sessionFacadeFactor.description: To use a custom CMISSessionFacadeFactory to create the CMISSessionFacade instances
